AV = AutoViz_Class()

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.b54d11e5:
data = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/yahoo-finance-apple-inc-aapl/AAPL_Montly_updates.csv')
df = AV.AutoViz(filename="",sep=',', depVar='Adj Close', dfte=data, header=0, verbose=1, 
                 lowess=False, chart_format='svg', max_rows_analyzed=150000, max_cols_analyzed=30)

source.62f344c1:
## Introduction: Hi Everyone this note book is a guide and a littel into to my Dataset "Yahoo Finance Apple Inc. (AAPL)". Link - https://www.kaggle.com/achintyatripathi/yahoo-finance-apple-inc-aapl
This is Historical Data which contains data that tells the onening and closing price of the market. The highest and lowest points and also tells about VWAP . It have data of one whole year, which is divided into 3 parts ---
1.Daily updates 2. Weekly updates, 3. Monthly Updates. In this notebook I am going to explore the data using AutoViz_class liberary. Which can plot various graphs and reduce the time spend on EDA.
However the real part of the is the Time series analysis and prediction. I will request everyone to give it a shot and try their hands on this dataset. Thank You. ### Do UpVote and comment on the Dataset and kernel it will help me grow and improve the quality of my work. Thank You once again. 🙏😃
